intro: Aotus mollis, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of trees such as oaks and pines. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer. Its berries are usually red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Aotus mollis plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for various wildlife species.
